stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Bozo’s Oil Rig, focusing on wet-cement footprints, a construction-worker Koopa NPC, and early visual ideas for a Tox Box redesign while debugging crashes and texture math.

development_findings.summary: Implemented footprint system for wet cement: ground-pound butt print, dive/sliding streaks, and darkness that accumulates with repeated contact.
development_findings.quote: So today we're gonna finish programming this finally. We're gonna give Mario a butt print that appears when you do a ground pound here.

development_findings.summary: Discovered and patched an odd/even-pixel bug in the I4 texture math that caused every other footprint tile to render incorrectly.
development_findings.quote: The code for even numbers is malfunctioning right now, which is weird, because the one for odd numbers should be a lot harder to do.

development_findings.summary: Encountered a compiler anomaly he calls a GCC bug while linking identical references; learned to re-structure code to bypass it.
development_findings.quote: That is a legitimate GCC bug. Why would it work now, but it didn't work before?

development_findings.summary: Stage features gated cement pit watched by a builder Koopa; Mario can ruin the surface, triggering the Koopa’s angry reaction event.
development_findings.quote: Basically what this is going to be. This guy is watching his cement bit that he just laid out, and Mario … ruins all the cement and the guy is going to get upset.

development_findings.summary: Created fatigued construction-worker Koopa: new helmet, tired eyes, dark-green shell and work boots; Zeina will supply idle, angry, carrying-glass, walking and falling animations.
development_findings.quote: Any change requests—speak now or shut up forever.

development_findings.summary: Planned Tox Box reskin as shipping-container cubes with industrial metal texture and symmetrical faces to fit the oil-rig theme.
development_findings.quote: Maybe I can just do this, but with a face on it. I'll give that a try.

development_findings.summary: Added rainbow outline to stars, inspired by Mario Sunshine.
development_findings.quote: Yeah, I added a little rainbow around it too. This is kind of stolen from Mario Sunshine.

development_findings.summary: Overworld redesign idea: global coins, shop items (e.g., buy a power-star boost), donate to NPCs to change the hub, Yoshi coins; came after debate with Biobak.
development_findings.quote: I think we've come to a pretty good agreement … you'll be able to buy different stuff.

development_findings.summary: Wrote highly optimized atan2s routine he claims matches academic papers; may release a technical video.
development_findings.quote: Someone sent me a paper and they were like, oh wait, you did the same thing.

development_findings.summary: Full beta test revealed many crashes on real N64 hardware; performance still strong when it runs, but he needs tooling or new emulator features to isolate problems.
development_findings.quote: While it runs super well when it runs, there's still a lot of crashes … having a better N64 emulator that tells you why something crashes would be so useful.

context_findings.summary: Heat wave; streaming shirtless; no AC, only a ceiling fan; affects comfort during work.
context_findings.quote: I am basically just dying right now from all the heat.

context_findings.summary: Coding philosophy: ignores style questions—‘if the compiler doesn’t see a difference, I don’t either.’
context_findings.quote: Code style is just not a thing for me.

context_findings.summary: Says he never formally learned programming; feels born with it and just ‘looked at code.’
context_findings.quote: I literally just looked at code and was able to program. I have never learned it.

context_findings.summary: Not primarily motivated by money; believes he’d earn more elsewhere; streams and hacks because he simply ‘does it.’
context_findings.quote: I'm not motivated at all, so there's no motivation involved. I just do it.

context_findings.summary: Frustration with YouTube stream delay; left Twitch due to excessive ads.
context_findings.quote: That's the one thing holding YouTube streaming back for me right now—the fact that there's so much delay.

biobak.summary: Debated overworld redesign with Kaze in DMs and reached a compromise involving coin-based shop and hub changes.
biobak.quote: I've had some arguments with Biobak … and I think we've come to a pretty good agreement.

zeina.summary: Provided butt-print sprite asset for cement mechanic.
Will animate the construction Koopa (idle, angry, carry glass, walk, fall/slide) and already supplied full Wario animation set.
zeina.quote: I also sent you all of Wario's animations.

key_stories.title: The Footprint Bug
key_stories.summary: Kaze tried to implement wet-cement footprints but half the tiles rendered wrong. After tracing I4 texture math and an ‘even-pixel’ branch, he discovered reversed indices and fixed them, finally producing perfect circles.
key_stories.challenge: Every other footprint appeared corrupted due to incorrect byte indexing.
key_stories.process: Stepped through texture coordinates, compared odd vs. even code paths, identified swapped constants, patched both branches.
key_stories.outcome: Footprints now display correctly and darken with repeated contact.
key_stories.key_quote: Sometimes it's the perfect circle and sometimes it's this … That part was missing everywhere. No wonder this didn't work.

key_stories.title: Building the Tired Koopa Worker
key_stories.summary: Need for an NPC who guards fresh cement led to a new Koopa variant. Kaze collaborated with Zeina to design a construction helmet, fatigued eyes, matching boots, and planned animation list.
key_stories.challenge: Standard Koopa looked out of place on an oil rig and lacked personality.
key_stories.process: Sourced helmet reference, textured in GIMP, debated eye style, matched shell and boot colors, listed required animations for Zeina.
key_stories.outcome: Finished in-game model that ‘looks so good’ and will react to Mario ruining cement.
key_stories.key_quote: He looks better in game because still lighting in game is actually there and when that's not there … he just looks tired of working construction.
